results.name: Enumeration table T(n,k) by diagonals. The order of the list - if n is odd:  T(n,1), T(2,n-1), T(n-2,3),..., T(n-1,2), T(1,n); if n is even: T(1,n), T(n-1,2), T(3,n-2),..., T(2,n-1), T(n,1).
comment: Self-inverse permutation of the natural numbers.
a(n) is a pairing function: a function that reversibly maps Z^{+} x Z^{+} onto Z^{+}, where Z^{+} is the set of integer positive numbers.

Call a "layer" a pair of sides of square from T(1,n) to T(n,n) and from T(n,n) to T(n,1). This table read layer by layer clockwise is A194280. This table read by boustrophedonic ("ox-plowing") method - layer clockwise, layer counterclockwise and so on - is A064790. - _Boris Putievskiy_, Mar 14 2013
